Formal Methods

We develop mathematically grounded verification and runtime assurance methods to guarantee the safety and correctness of AI-driven systems.

Learn More

Safe LLM

We build compact and trustworthy domain-specific language models with improved interpretability, alignment, and robust decision-making.

LLM Portfolio

Medical AI

Our research spans ophthalmology, clinical decision support, and noise-robust diagnostic modeling, powered by domain-specialized LLMs for safer and more interpretable medical reasoning.

See Projects

Robot Racing

We explore autonomous racing, RoboRacer(F1TENTH) robotics, and safe high-speed navigation under real-world uncertainty.

Racing Lab

About Us

The AiX LabLab at Gyeongsang National University is committed to advancing the safety and trustworthiness of modern intelligent systems. We develop methods to ensure the reliability of CPS, medical AI, and autonomous driving AI through formal verification and practical software engineering.

 Research

We conduct research on the safety of software systems.

 Education

We provide education in AI, formal methods, and software engineering.

 Development

We develop medical AI and autonomous driving software for racing.

 Competition

We compete with other teams to build safer and more reliable software.

News

Updates from the AiX Lab, including research progress, publications, and people-related achievements.

People & Alumni News

AiX Lab · Alumni & Careers

  • Minwook Kwon (M.S., Aug. 2025) joined Public AI as an AI engineer.

  • Seungju Baek (M.S., Mar. 2025) joined Saltlux, contributing significantly to our Ophtimus research series.

Research Highlights

AiX Lab · Research Highlights 2025

The AiX Lab continues advancing research in AI Safety, Medical AI, and reliable machine learning systems. Our recent achievements include four SCI(E) publications in 2025, spanning formally verified CPS code generation, ophthalmic medical AI, video-based gait anomaly detection, and domain-specific large language models.

What our collaborators say

We work closely with clinicians and autonomous driving researchers in Korea and abroad.

Our clinical collaborators often describe our group as one of the key experts in applying AI to medicine, especially in ophthalmology.

Ophthalmology collaborators

Colleagues in autonomous driving research recognize us as specialists in the F1TENTH platform and one of the leading teams in Korean autonomous racing.

Autonomous driving collaborators
